fields.title: Test code
fields.content_r:
# -*- coding: utf-8 -*-
import simplejson
import datetime

from django import http
from django.contrib.auth.decorators import login_required
from django.utils.decorators import method_decorator

__author__ = 'Daniel Alkemic Czuba <dc@danielczuba.pl>'


class BreadcrumbsMixin(object):
    """ Mixin that pass breadcrumbs to request """
    breadcrumbs = {}

    def dispatch(self, request, *args, **kwargs):
        request.breadcrumbs = self.breadcrumbs
        return super(BreadcrumbsMixin, self).dispatch(request, *args, **kwargs)


class JSONResponseMixin(object):
    def render_to_response(self, context):
        """Returns a JSON response containing 'context' as payload"""
        return self.get_json_response(self.convert_context_to_json(context))

    def get_json_response(self, content, **httpresponse_kwargs):
        """Construct an `HttpResponse` object."""
        return http.HttpResponse(content,
                                 content_type='application/json',
                                 **httpresponse_kwargs)

    def convert_context_to_json(self, context):
        """Convert the context dictionary into a JSON object"""
        dthandler = lambda obj: obj.__str__() if isinstance(obj, datetime.datetime) else None
        return simplejson.dumps(context, default=dthandler)


class LoginRequiredMixin(object):
    """
    Mixin class, that decorates dispatch to force login
    """

    @method_decorator(login_required)
    def dispatch(self, request, *args, **kwargs):
        """
        dispatch
        """
        return super(LoginRequiredMixin, self).dispatch(request, *args, **kwargs)

fields.title: CV
fields.content:
[u][b]Podsumowanie zawodowe[/b][/u]
[list]
[*] Cztery lata komercyjnego doświadczenia w programowaniu
[*] Doświadczenie w administracją serwerami WWW
[*] Bardzo dobra umiejętność samouki i rozwijania swoich umiejętności
[*] Podejście „can do it”
[*] Zdolność zarządzania małym (2-3 osoby) zespołem programistów
[/list]

[u][b]Kariera zawodowa[/b][/u]
[b]07.2011 – nadal - Mindz Sp. z o.o. Sp. k. - Główny Programista/Head IT[/b]
Do moich obowiązków należało tworzenie i rozwijanie nowych portali, dobór technologi, pomoc programistom z mniejszym stażem oraz administracja serwerami produkcyjnymi i deweloperskimi
Wykonane serwisu:
[list]
[*] multibiznes.pl – portal networkingowy TaxCare, został wykonany przy użyciu Zend Framework 1 
[*] ogradzamy.pl – portal ekspercki Betafence, wykonany w technologii Django
[/list]

[b]05.2010 – 06.2011 - Effigo Sp. z o.o. - Programista PHP[/b]
Wykonane serwisu:
[list]
[*] mementis.pl
[*] podatnik.info
[/list]
[b]2009 – 06.2011 - Działalność freelancerska[/b]

[u][b]Umiejętności[/b][/u]
[list]
[*] Bardzo dobra znajomość działania aplikacji webowych
[*] Bardzo dobra znajomość Zend Framework (8/10) i PHP5 (8/10) – 4 letnie doświadczenie
[*] Bardzo dobra znajomość 
[*] Dobra znajomość znajomość Django (5/10) i Pythona (5/10) – roczne doświadczenie
[*] Dobra znajomość JavaScript (5/10)
[*] Dobra znajomość baz danych MySQL (7/10) i PostgreSQL (5/10) oraz podstawowa CouchDB i MongoDB
[*] Znajomość systemów kontroli wersji (SVN oraz GIT) od strony użytkownika i administratora
[*] Język angielski: posługiwanie bierne w stopniu dobrym, posługiwanie aktywne w stopniu średnim
[/list]

[u][b]Zainteresowania[/b][/u]
[list]
[*] Gotowanie
[*] Słuchanie muzyki
[*] Łucznictwo tradycyjne
[*] Dogtrekking
[/list]
fields.content_r:

  • Dobra znajomość baz danych MySQL (7/10) i PostgreSQL (5/10) oraz podstawowa CouchDB i MongoDB
  • Znajomość systemów kontroli wersji (SVN oraz GIT) od strony użytkownika i administratora

fields.title: About
fields.content:
Here is few words about me in favor of usesthis.com.

[h4]Who are you, and what do you do?[/h4]

I'm Daniel, a 28 yo web developer. Living (dream ;-) ) in Wroclaw, Poland.
Since 2009 I work as a web developer, mostly in PHP (Zend Framework, Kohana)

[h4]What hardware do you use?[/h4]

I'm using an Lenovo ThinkPad T430s, with Benq G2420HDBL as my primary display. Quite good setup, beside that both are TN displays.

HTC Desire Z is my smartphone, great phone with nice QWERTY keyboard for my big thumbs. ;-)

At this point I'm building a CarPC based on Via Epia TC-10000 with simple 20x4 HD44780 display. Maybe display will be upgraded to some 7" LCD, but not too much for a start.

[h4]And what software?[/h4]

I've been using Linux since 1999, Debian since 2010. XFce as my WM.
For past two years I'm using PyCharm (and PhpStorm for PHP development) as my IDE, it has great code introspection and overall project managing, including good integration with VCS, easy to setup DB connector, refactoring, and so on. :-)
For my first steps into Arduino development I've been using Sublime with Stino plugin.

[h4]What would be your dream setup?[/h4]

A Gigabyte BRIX with i7-4770R, and dual Dell's UltraSharp setup would be nice. I'm still waiting to replace my phone with something that is worth my money, and will be serious upgrade to it.

PS. I'm owner of fantastic dog, called Bolt. :-)
fields.content_r:

Who are you, and what do you do?

I'm Daniel, a 28 yo web developer. Living (dream ;-) ) in Wroclaw, Poland.
Since 2009 I work as a web developer, mostly in PHP (Zend Framework, Kohana)

What hardware do you use?

I'm using an Lenovo ThinkPad T430s, with Benq G2420HDBL as my primary display. Quite good setup, beside that both are TN displays.

HTC Desire Z is my smartphone, great phone with nice QWERTY keyboard for my big thumbs. ;-)

At this point I'm building a CarPC based on Via Epia TC-10000 with simple 20x4 HD44780 display. Maybe display will be upgraded to some 7" LCD, but not too much for a start.

And what software?

I've been using Linux since 1999, Debian since 2010. XFce as my WM.
For past two years I'm using PyCharm (and PhpStorm for PHP development) as my IDE, it has great code introspection and overall project managing, including good integration with VCS, easy to setup DB connector, refactoring, and so on. :-)
For my first steps into Arduino development I've been using Sublime with Stino plugin.

What would be your dream setup?

A Gigabyte BRIX with i7-4770R, and dual Dell's UltraSharp setup would be nice. I'm still waiting to replace my phone with something that is worth my money, and will be serious upgrade to it.

PS. I'm owner of fantastic dog, called Bolt. :-)

fields.title: Résumé
fields.content:
[list]
[*] Four years, commercial, experience in programming
[*] Experience in managing web servers
[*] Great self-learning skills and develop own skills 
[*] „Can do it” attitude
[*] The ability to manage a small (2-3 person) development team
[/list]

[u][b]Career[/b][/u]
[b]07.2011 – present - Mindz Sp. z o.o. Sp. k. - Lead Senior Developer/Head IT[/b]
[list]
[*] Design and development of application in Zend Framework and Django 
[*] Aid in the selection technologies
[*] Setting standards for the company 
[*] Training and help less experienced developers
[*] Production and development servers administration
[*] Analysis of customer requirements
[/list]

[b]05.2010 – 06.2011 - Effigo Sp. z o.o. - PHP Developer[/b]
[list]
[*] Design and development of application in Zend Framework
[*] Help less experienced developers
[*] Production and developing servers administration
[/list]
[b]2009 – 2012 - Freelance[/b]
[list]
[*] Creating applications in Zend Framework and Django
[/list]

[u][b]Skills[/b][/u]
[list]
[*] Very good knowledge of web application
[*] Very good knowledge of Zend Framework (8/10) and PHP5 (8/10)
[*] Good knowledge of knowledge of Django (5/10) and Python (5/10)
[*] Good knowledge of JavaScript (5/10) 
[*] Good knowledge of MySQL database (7/10) and PostgreSQL (5/10) and basics CouchDB and MongoDB
[*] Knowledge of version control systems (SVN and GIT) from the user and administrator 
[*] Knowledge of issues related to usability 
[*] Basic knowledge of the Arduino platform 
[*] English: average level in passive, moderately in active
[/list]

[u][b]Interests[/b][/u]
Cooking, Traditional archery, Dogtrekking
